Class ProjectLogic

java.lang.Object
ProjectLogic
public class ProjectLogic extends Object
Provides logic operations on Project objects.

Utility class that contains static methods for filtering and displaying project data based on various criteria including marital status and officer assignments.

  • Method Details

    • filterProjectsByMaritalStatus

      public static ArrayList<Project> filterProjectsByMaritalStatus(ArrayList<Project> projects, MaritalStatus maritalStatus)
      Method to filter projects based on the marital status of the applicant Returns projects that either:
      • Have no marital status restriction (null)
      • Match the specified marital status
      Parameters:
      projects - List of projects to filter
      maritalStatus - The marital status to filter by
      Returns:
      Filtered list of compatible projects
      See Also:
      • Project
      • MaritalStatus

    • filterProjectsForOfficer

      public static ArrayList<Project> filterProjectsForOfficer(ArrayList<Project> projects, HDBOfficer officer)
      Filters projects for a specific HDB officer.

      This method filters out projects that the officer is already in charge of, allowing them to view only the projects they can apply to.

      Parameters:
      projects - List of all projects
      officer - The HDB officer to filter projects for
      Returns:
      Filtered list of projects available for the officer to apply to
      See Also:
      • Project
      • HDBOfficer

    • filterProjectsManagedOfficer

      public static ArrayList<Project> filterProjectsManagedOfficer(ArrayList<Project> projects, HDBOfficer officer)
      Filters projects managed by a specific HDB officer.

      This method filters out projects that the officer is managing, allowing them to view only the projects they are responsible for.

      Parameters:
      projects - List of all projects
      officer - The HDB officer to filter projects for
      Returns:
      Filtered list of projects managed by the officer
      See Also:
      • Project
      • HDBOfficer

    • filterProjectsNamesForApplicant

      public static ArrayList<Project> filterProjectsNamesForApplicant(ArrayList<Project> projects, Applicant applicant)
      Filters projects for a specific applicant.

      This method filters out projects that the applicant has already applied to, allowing them to view only the projects they can apply to.

      Parameters:
      projects - List of all projects
      applicant - The applicant to filter projects for
      Returns:
      Filtered list of projects available for the applicant to apply to
      See Also:
      • Project
      • Applicant

    • viewAvailableProjects

      public static int viewAvailableProjects(ArrayList<Project> projects, Applicant applicant)
      Displays all available projects that are visible to applicants.
      Parameters:
      projects - list of all projects to display
      applicant - the applicant whose past applications are to be considered
      Returns:
      the number of available projects displayed

    • getApplicantProjects

      public static ArrayList<Project> getApplicantProjects(ArrayList<Project> projects, Applicant applicant)
      Returns the first available project that the applicant has not applied to.
      Parameters:
      projects - List of all projects
      applicant - The applicant to check against
      Returns:
      List of available projects that the applicant has not applied to

    • getProjectNames

      public static ArrayList<String> getProjectNames(ArrayList<Project> projects)
      Returns a list of project names from a list of projects.
      Parameters:
      projects - List of projects to extract names from
      Returns:
      List of project names

    • displayHDBOfficers

      public static void displayHDBOfficers(ArrayList<HDBOfficer> officers)
      Displays HDB officers details.

      Prints each officer's details with a numbered index, using their toString() representation. The display format is: Officer ID: [index] [officer details]

      Parameters:
      officers - List of HDB officers to display
      See Also:
      • HDBOfficer.toString()
